website_summaries.verdict: This basic, no-frills bamboo kendama is a great choice for older elementary age children.
pros: 7-inch size designed for small hands, for ages 6 and up
String tethers ball to handle for safety
Minimalist unpainted look with no paint to chip
cons: String may come undone, although you can learn how to retie it

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but for a reason
customer_reviews.text: PROS: 1. Cheap cheap cheap 2. Comes in nice recyclable package CONS: 1. Feels cheaper than the others I bought 2. Has some chips and sings which I showed in pictures 3. Came in an opened box! Ew? It’s probably good enough for someone that doesn’t know Kendama but this ones basically a beater for me. I’ll mostly use my nicer ones. Not very impressed for AMAZONS CHOICE
customer_reviews.author: jake walters

customer_reviews.title: Box destroyed and also cracks
customer_reviews.text: I love the product but sadly my box was destroyed which kinda bugs me. Update: I been using it for a little and it cracks in some areas which is poor quality I’ve only used it like 10 times since I got it
customer_reviews.author: Enrique

customer_reviews.title: Simple and fun, be careful not to get addicted
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting one of these for a long time now, and if I don't pay attention I can be at it for a long time trying to catch the ball and flip the kendama to catch it again multiple times. Sometimes I try to see how many catches I can chain together. I have to admit that for some reason, I really want to get good at this thing, enough to be considered a "pro". Reminds me of what it is to have old school and simple fun like when I was a kid.
customer_reviews.author: Mayra S.

customer_reviews.title: not bad
customer_reviews.text: I like the two tone bamboo, i'm not sure how heavy a real kendama ball is but this one is hefty. The basic construction is nice, but i can see some rough areas that weren't shaved out of the cup areas, for example my ozara (large cup) had lines that weren't smoothed out. So i can see why these kendama's are slightly cheaper then the ones from Japan. But don't let that deter you, overall they work, and this one looks better then most out there for this price, so 4 stars. Knocked off 1 star just because i think just a little more work in the sanding process and these would be pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: MalekoTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Something kids can play with by themselves.
customer_reviews.text: The kids are having a lot of fun with these Kendama things. I only gave it four stars because, I can't do it! The quality seems good. I like that there is no paint to peel or chip as some other people have mentioned about some other Kendamas. It was a good purchase. Kendamas are becoming more popular as people hear about them. They are more challenging than the old ball on a string toys of yore. They may be a little too challenging for five and six year olds who may get discouraged before they start having fun with it. I would purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: Gone Girl

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son and he loves it! It was priced really well and nice quality which is important for my 10 year old. He can break anything.
customer_reviews.author: T.Hadley

customer_reviews.title: Toy
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, sturdy, well made. A little bit smaller than anticipated, but a good gift.
customer_reviews.author: The PI

customer_reviews.title: Huge chip off of a cup after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: We loved it: our 7 year old son very much enjoyed passing with it until, 2 months after the day he started using it, a large part of a cup chipped off. We are bummed because it looked really solid. I'd but it again but I want it to last longer than 2 months. Toysmith, if you are reading this, please shoot me a note: can you replace our kendama free of charge? Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: TGFam

customer_reviews.title: This is a mig, while Cherry Kendamas are F-22s
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it functioned as a kendama should. I didn't like how soft the wood was and how easily it gets knicked. Looks wise the Cherry Wood kendama is vastly superior. The Cherry Wood one also feels much better.
customer_reviews.author: Corbin Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Good gift
customer_reviews.text: Not like the high quality kendamas they sell but For the price and for someone just getting into the hobby it’s a great gift
customer_reviews.author: Jace Skidmore

customer_reviews.title: Purchase this for older children only
customer_reviews.text: This toy was too hard for my 9 year old grandsons. It is a beautiful little toy. The wood is nice. It’s just too difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Yaiyai

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 12 year old son and he absolutely loves it. My husband and I even took it over because it was so much fun to play with. I think I need to buy a few more for my husband and other kids. It is well made and very nice. It has definitely kept my son busy for hours and he is not tired of it yet after two months.
customer_reviews.author: tmleifson

customer_reviews.title: but can be replaced easily with simply string
customer_reviews.text: Well made, but the string frays, but can be replaced easily with simply string. This toy is the rage at my kids' school. See, screens have not stolen our children and melted their brains.
customer_reviews.author: E. B.

customer_reviews.title: Glad I chose this one!
customer_reviews.text: After yoyoing for awhile I kept hearing about kendamas, so I decided to try one out. I found this one with Prime shipping and had to go for it, the sooner the better. I am really impressed with this thing! I know it is of great quality because I was able to pull off some tricks I saw on YouTube fairly quickly. Love the look and feel and it's very solid. Highly recommended for anyone new to kendama or anyone looking for a new one!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Ehh, if you don't care.
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and go to a real kendama site. You can find a better product for a little bit more. This is Bamboo and not heavy or weighted like a real hardwood kendama you would usually find. IT is glossy so you are not able to do stalls or tricks like a lighthouse. I'd buy something else
customer_reviews.author: Olga  S Kormuskina

customer_reviews.title: Looks Nice, Son Likes It (a chunk of wood came out after a week)
customer_reviews.text: My son really wanted one of these and it looks very nice the the bamboo layers. A piece of it cracked off after a week or so. I didn't bother to return it because my son is still playing with it and he does have another one.
customer_reviews.author: NinjaMom

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy!
customer_reviews.text: My boys love this toy and the challenge it provides
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Good quality kendama.
customer_reviews.text: I wish kids would play with more toys like this. Takes a few trys but once you get going its a lot of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Simon C. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: great toy!
customer_reviews.text: Very high-quality product! It is fun to play with (albeit kendamas are a bit difficult to learn, so if you're looking for an easy toy for a younger kid maybe get something else), and especially fun when I do it in front of friends and they try to do it yet fail miserably (again, a bit difficult to learn, but once you get it it is very fun!).
customer_reviews.author: L. Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Well made.
customer_reviews.text: Fun and entertaining. It appears to be well made. It should last for years. My 12 yr old granddaughter enjoyed playing with it several times during her visit over Thanksgiving. If you miss to often and hit yourself with the ball it can hurt a little.
customer_reviews.author: Spunk

customer_reviews.title: Fun for "adult" kids
customer_reviews.text: I buy my young adult children and their boyfriends/girlfriends a toy every year for Christmas. The Kendama was a real hit with all of them, including the biggest kid in the family, my husband. Nice quality, nice look, challenging and fun. I bought extra strings but have not had to replace them yet.
customer_reviews.author: maryann dommer

customer_reviews.title: and I love that he's developing new skills through play
customer_reviews.text: my son loves this!! and I love that he's developing new skills through play! This was his first and we also bought one with a silk ball. If you want your child to advance their skills with ease, try the silk ball first and then graduate to this one. But in my opinion, this kendama's build and quality is better and has survived more abuse.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: It is too small. Quality is outstanding. Maybe ...
customer_reviews.text: It is too small. Quality is outstanding. Maybe for small kids it will be ok. My 11 year old likes it but if I researched it more would have gone bigger than a 7 inch.
customer_reviews.author: XSTEEL

customer_reviews.title: My kids love these. I bought this and a cute turquoise ...
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these. I bought this and a cute turquoise and grey plastic one. They both fight over this one. It's more weighty and just better quality overall.
customer_reviews.author: ShawnAndTiffany

customer_reviews.title: It is alright for the price
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. This was one of the cheaper kendamas I saw so I bought it. I don't regret it, but it was not my best purchase. It is a nice kids toy but not a "real" kendama. Feels cheap and the ball was strung for a lefty out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah Scheel

customer_reviews.title: Great Kendama
customer_reviews.text: Great Kendama. Local surf shop is selling these for more than twice this price. Great price, sturdy, well-made product. Bought a second one already for my other son. Highly recommend. Lots of good, old-fashioned fun! Highly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: MJB

customer_reviews.title: As a wood worker from the old days I liked this model
customer_reviews.text: As a wood worker from the old days I liked this model. Bought it for my youngest son. It dented up pretty fast. Thought bamboo would hold up better than south american poached wood. Not so. Learn to handle it and move on to something better.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy R. Sixberry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our elementary school kids
customer_reviews.text: Quality item. Solid bamboo construction. Perfect for our elementary school kids. It's all the rage at school right now. I love that there is no paint to chip. They have used it for hours and it still looks great. I can't say the same for the other one I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Micromom

customer_reviews.title: Great Gifts
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 4 of these for Christmas gifts for kids in the family. They were a big hit, everyone loved them. I even had fun trying one out. I may buy one for myself. They were all well made and the kids will have fun for years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cool Bamboo Kendama
customer_reviews.text: Our six year old son has been asking us for a Kendama all school year. Rather then go buy one from the local store that sells them we wanted to get him something a bit different. The Bamboo look is really cool and the product is good quality. He's enjoying learning how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph E. Henning

customer_reviews.title: Order this for my sons birthday. Cute toy but ...
customer_reviews.text: Order this for my sons birthday. Cute toy but did not stand a chance with boys. After the first week the glue came out in the top. Might reorder again when they are a little older.
customer_reviews.author: Tink

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Kendama Crazy kid
customer_reviews.text: My son came home from school wanting to buy a Kendama. I said "You want a what?" He replied, just google it. So I did and found this one that was in his price range (yes, I made him buy it.) It has been great and worked well for him.
customer_reviews.author: Lucinda Wade

customer_reviews.title: Olden day fun
customer_reviews.text: Great game to pass the time. My boys ages 13, 12, and 9 enjoy this simple wooden game. I find them challenging themselves and other friends! Great purchase and great fun without having to be plugged into a video game!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: great value, great toy! This would make a good gift for any age.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline M. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Great Kendama!
customer_reviews.text: No complaints from my son! Received the Kendama very quickly and the quality of it is very good. He enjoys playing with it very much. Seems to be the "in" thing now.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry  Matthews

customer_reviews.title: We got this for my son at Christmas this year ...
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my son at Christmas this year. He used it all the time until it broke (the string came disconnected and unable to reattach) just this past week.
customer_reviews.author: Becky H

customer_reviews.title: Great Kendama at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great Kendama at a great price. Has endured hours of play where as the one we bought at the store with the colorful ball has had the string detach numerous times already... This one has worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Junebug858

customer_reviews.title: Challenging, fun for all ages
customer_reviews.text: Everyone tries hard to be the best at this tricky toy. Fun for all ages (but over 8 is best, because it's hard and takes dexterity and concentration.)
customer_reviews.author: trilobyte

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this, and used it to the ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this, and used it to the point of wearing it out! We got it here on Amazon for less than half what they were selling for in stores in our area.
customer_reviews.author: J.Richards

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Great Kendama. Still using it today after about 4months of us. Quality wood and quality built. I know have two, one for my kid.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My son loved this toy, he is 12 years old. The quality of the product is really good
customer_reviews.author: Yoana Beddes

customer_reviews.title: It is well constructed and is a great value for your money
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this and is playing with it constantly. It is well constructed and is a great value for your money. He has hit the ball on a few things and it hasn't broken. I would recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Chrisf

customer_reviews.title: We've ordered two of these and they are perfect. They are lightweight and have a nice clear ...
customer_reviews.text: We've ordered two of these and they are perfect. They are lightweight and have a nice clear coating over the wood so it doesn't chip when the ball hits the mallet or the top. I'd recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen N.

customer_reviews.title: but my wife loves it and is getting good.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 6-year-old as a Christmas present, she doesn't really use it - probably above her age level, but my wife loves it and is getting good.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hassler

customer_reviews.title: A good way to work on coordination
customer_reviews.text: I bought the kids one for Christmas and then decided to buy one for myself. A good way to work on coordination. Try it with your other hand once you can do the basics with primary hand.
customer_reviews.author: LL on the Prairie

customer_reviews.title: Awsome kendama
customer_reviews.text: This kendama was a great buy, my 11 year son loves playing with it. The bamboo is greta quality, if you are looking to buy a kendama then this is the one to go to. It is for any player from beginner to advanced.

customer_reviews.title: Very addicting wooden toy ;)
customer_reviews.text: My 7yr old loves this thing. Seems to be great quality so far. Looks and feels good. Price is great. I never knew a wooden ball on a string/stick would be so popular! Haha all the kids at school have them.
customer_reviews.author: Jbug

customer_reviews.title: Great quality in a kendama
customer_reviews.text: Great quality in a kendama. I have recommended this brand to many others and it has yet to disappoint. I am pleased with the bamboo and how it has worn with many, many hours of play.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good starter or backup.

customer_reviews.title: Great fun!

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but not the best quality
customer_reviews.text: My son loved it, but it began falling apart after about 3 days of fairly heavy use. The string frayed and broke the very first day. As the break was close to the end we were able to restring it with what was left. Two days later the string broke again. By that time some of the layers of wood were also chipping along the edges where they were glued.

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!

product_meta.title: Neato! Classics by Toysmith Bamboo Kendama Juggling Skill Toy (7-Inch), Multi
product_meta.description:
The Toysmith Bamboo Kendama is a modern take on classic children's toy. This ancient Japanese game of skill involves tossing a small wooden ball and catching it in one of the kendama's shallow cups. The kendama's authentic bamboo construction is both lightweight and very durable. A string tether anchors the kendama's wooden ball to the handle for safety. At 7 inches long, the kendama is designed with small hands in mind. Recommended for ages 6 years and up.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Solid bamboo gives Toysmith's 7" Bamboo Kendama durability as well as natural beauty. This ancient Japanese skill game is fun to play, just toss and catch. Perfect for ages 6 years and up.
feature_bullets: This ancient Japanese game of skill involves tossing a small wooden ball and catching it in one of the kendama's shallow cups.
The kendama's authentic bamboo construction is both lightweight and very durable.
A string tether anchors the kendama's wooden ball to the handle for safety.
At 7 inches long, the kendama is designed with small hands in mind.
Recommended for ages 6 years and up.
Challenge your children's imaginations and keep them active with Toysmith.
Committed to providing the most imaginative toys along with the highest safety standards, Toysmith has toys appropriate for all age groups.
Toysmith offers toys for any kind of play: active play, science and discovery, arts and crafts, impulse and novelty toys, and nostalgic retro classics.
Real bamboo that gives this Kendama natural beauty
